headline: Piper Sandler lifts Hershey and Colgate, but remains cautious on Procter & Gamble
summary: Investing.com -- Piper Sandler has updated coverage across the consumer staples sector, highlighting diverging outlooks for Procter & Gamble, Hershey and Colgate-Palmolive.

headline: Shaq-A-Licious SLAMS, Shaquille O'Neal's New Hoops-Inspired Candy, Throws Down a Backboard-Breaking Bite
summary: Get ready to stack it, slam it and snack it! Introducing Shaq-A-Licious SLAMS – a multi-textural gummy candy by Shaquille O'Neal and The Hershey Company, now available at retailers nationwide. Featuring three sweet, crunchy gummy balls in watermelon, strawberry and orange flavors and a chewy, sour mango ring, Shaq-A-Licious SLAMS celebrates Shaquille's love of slam dunks, hoops and big kid energy.

headline: Is Hershey (HSY) Pricing Look Stretched After Multi‑Year Share Price Gains
summary: If you have ever wondered whether Hershey at around US$179 per share is priced richly or still offers value, you are not alone. The stock has slipped about 1.6% over the last week and 1.7% over the last month, while still showing an 11.9% return over the past year and 35.2% over five years. Recent coverage has focused on Hershey as a long established consumer staples name, with investors weighing its defensive qualities against changing consumer preferences and cost pressures. That backdrop...

headline: Hershey to Webcast Fourth-Quarter Conference Call
summary: The Hershey Company (NYSE: HSY) announced today that it will release its fourth-quarter sales and earnings results on Thursday, February 5, 2026, and hold a conference call with analysts at 8:30 a.m. ET on that date. The company will host the conference call via a live webcast on the Hershey corporate website. Please click here and navigate to "CALENDAR OF EVENTS" for webcast details.

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Hershey (HSY) As Shorts Rise And Profit Outlook Softens
summary: In recent days, The Hershey Co. has seen short interest as a share of float rise to 7.21%, while analysts now expect earnings per share to fall compared with last year even as quarterly revenue is projected to increase. This mix of higher short positioning, lower profit expectations, and firmer sales forecasts highlights growing debate over how resilient Hershey’s business model is in a tougher backdrop. With analysts forecasting weaker earnings per share but higher revenue, we’ll examine...
